member.name: T:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ICholeskyDecomposition
member.summary: Cholesky Decomposition of a symmetric, positive definite matrix.
member.remarks: For a symmetric, positive definite matrix A, the Cholesky decomposition is a lower triangular matrix L so that A = L * L'. If the matrix is not symmetric or positive definite, the constructor returns a partial decomposition and sets two internal variables that can be queried using the and properties.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ICholeskyDecomposition.Solve(Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.IMatrix)
member.summary: Solves a set of equation systems of type A * X = B.
member.param: Right hand side matrix with as many rows as A and any number of columns.
member.returns: Matrix X so that L * L' * X = B.
member.exception: Matrix is not symmetrix and positive definite.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ICholeskyDecomposition.IsPositiveDefinite
member.summary: Returns if the matrix is positive definite.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ICholeskyDecomposition.IsSymmetric
member.summary: Returns if the matrix is symmetric.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ICholeskyDecomposition.LeftTriangularFactor
member.summary: Returns the left triangular factor L so that A = L * L'.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ILuDecomposition
member.summary: LU decomposition of a rectangular matrix.
member.remarks: For an m-by-n matrix A with m >= n, the LU decomposition is an m-by-n unit lower triangular matrix L, an n-by-n upper triangular matrix U, and a permutation vector piv of length m so that A(piv)=L*U. If m < n, then L is m-by-m and U is m-by-n. The LU decompostion with pivoting always exists, even if the matrix is singular, so the constructor will never fail. The primary use of the LU decomposition is in the solution of square systems of simultaneous linear equations. This will fail if returns .

member.name: M:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ILuDecomposition.Solve(Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.IMatrix)
member.summary: Solves a set of equation systems of type A * X = B.
member.param: Right hand side matrix with as many rows as A and any number of columns.
member.returns: Matrix X so that L * U * X = B.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ILuDecomposition.IsNonSingular
member.summary: Returns if the matrix is non-singular.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ILuDecomposition.Determinant
member.summary: Returns the determinant of the matrix.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ILuDecomposition.LowerTriangularFactor
member.summary: Returns the lower triangular factor L with A=LU.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ILuDecomposition.UpperTriangularFactor
member.summary: Returns the lower triangular factor L with A=LU.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ILuDecomposition.PivotPermutationVector
member.summary: Returns the pivot permuation vector.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.IQrDecomposition
member.summary: QR decomposition for a rectangular matrix.
member.remarks: For an m-by-n matrix A with m >= n, the QR decomposition is an m-by-n orthogonal matrix Q and an n-by-n upper triangular matrix R so that A = Q * R. The QR decompostion always exists, even if the matrix does not have full rank, so the constructor will never fail. The primary use of the QR decomposition is in the least squares solution of nonsquare systems of simultaneous linear equations. This will fail if returns .

member.name: M:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.IQrDecomposition.Solve(Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.IMatrix)
member.summary: Least squares solution of A * X = B
member.param: Right-hand-side matrix with as many rows as A and any number of columns.
member.returns: A matrix that minimized the two norm of Q * R * X - B.
member.exception: Matrix row dimensions must be the same.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.IQrDecomposition.IsFullRank
member.summary: Shows if the matrix A is of full rank.
member.value: The value is if R, and hence A, has full rank.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.IQrDecomposition.UpperTriangularFactor
member.summary: Returns the upper triangular factor R.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.IQrDecomposition.OrthogonalFactor
member.summary: Returns the orthogonal factor Q.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ISingularValueDecomposition
member.summary: Singular Value Decomposition for a rectangular matrix.
member.remarks: For an m-by-n matrix A with m >= n, the singular value decomposition is an m-by-n orthogonal matrix U, an n-by-n diagonal matrix S, and an n-by-n orthogonal matrix V so that A = U * S * V'. The singular values, sigma[k] = S[k,k], are ordered so that sigma[0] >= sigma[1] >= ... >= sigma[n-1]. The singular value decompostion always exists, so the constructor will never fail. The matrix condition number and the effective numerical rank can be computed from this decomposition.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ISingularValueDecomposition.Condition
member.summary: Returns the condition number max(S) / min(S).

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ISingularValueDecomposition.Norm2
member.summary: Returns the Two norm.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ISingularValueDecomposition.Rank
member.summary: Returns the effective numerical matrix rank.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.ISingularValueDecomposition.Diagonal
member.summary: Return the one-dimensional array of singular values.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.IEigenvalueDecomposition
member.summary: Determines the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a real square matrix.
member.remarks: If A is symmetric, then A = V * D * V' and A = V * V' where the eigenvalue matrix D is diagonal and the eigenvector matrix V is orthogonal. If A is not symmetric, the eigenvalue matrix D is block diagonal with the real eigenvalues in 1-by-1 blocks and any complex eigenvalues, lambda+i*mu, in 2-by-2 blocks, [lambda, mu; -mu, lambda]. The columns of V represent the eigenvectors in the sense that A * V = V * D. The matrix V may be badly conditioned, or even singular, so the validity of the equation A=V*D*inverse(V) depends upon the condition of V.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.IEigenvalueDecomposition.RealEigenvalues
member.summary: Returns the real parts of the eigenvalues.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.IEigenvalueDecomposition.ImaginaryEigenvalues
member.summary: Returns the imaginary parts of the eigenvalues.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.IEigenvalueDecomposition.EigenvectorMatrix
member.summary: Returns the eigenvector matrix.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Util.IEigenvalueDecomposition.DiagonalMatrix
member.summary: Returns the block diagonal eigenvalue matrix.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar
member.summary: Calendar WebControl.
member.remarks:
Represents a control that contains a monthly calendar. You can use designer to control the properties and add new Items or you can use databinding to populate control. You can override default rendering by specifying templates. Look into specific template documentation for code examples.
If template is not specified default layout is used.
Use "CalendarViewChange" to react on event when calendar view is changed internally. You'll find example project that does that in the distribute package.
Use OnItemCreated and OnItemDataBound event to modify data bound items.
View type is controlled by ViewType property which can be changed in design ot runtime. Views allowed are YearView, MonthView, WorkWeekView, WeekView, WeekView2, DayView.
Use SpanType property to specify if you want spanning event. There are 2 options available Multiline, Overflow. Multiline will render spanning box and it's height will be based on how much text is entered. Overflow will also renders box spanning across the days/hours but height is fixed (for month view) and text that didn't fit the space provided will be hidden.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.DataBind
member.summary: Binds the control and all its child controls to the data source specified by the DataSource property.
member.remarks: Use the DataBind method to bind the data source specified by the DataSource property with the data list control. By binding the data source with a data listing control, the information in the data source is displayed in a data listing control. The DataBind method is also commonly used to synchronize the data source and a data listing control after information in the data source is updated. This allows any changes in the data source to also be updated in a data listing control.

members.member:
Raises the event. This allows you to provide a custom handler for the event.
A that contains event data. Use the OnItemCreated method to provide a custom handler for the ItemCreated event.
The ItemCreated event is raised when an item in the Calendar control is created, both during round-trips and at the time data is bound to the control. The ItemCreated event is commonly used to control the content and appearance of a cell in the Calendar control. Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Raising an Event. The OnItemCreated method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

Raises the event. This allows you to provide a custom handler for the event.
A that contains event data. Use the OnItemCommand method to provide a custom handler for the ItemCommand event.
The OnItemCommand event is raised when an item in the Calendar control is clicked.

Raises the event. This allows you to provide a custom handler for the event.
A that contains event data. Use the OnItemCreated method to provide a custom handler for the ItemCreated event.
Use the OnItemDataBound method to provide a custom handler for the ItemDataBound event. The ItemDataBound event is raised after an item is data bound to the Calendar control. This event provides you with the last opportunity to access the data item before it is displayed on the client. After this event is raised, the data item is nulled out and no longer available. Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Raising an Event. The OnItemDataBound method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
